title: After call to help find T ‘deviant,’ MBTA police make an arrest
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Robert McCarty, 49, pleaded not guilty Tuesday to one count of open and gross lewdness.

By Abby Patkin December 31, 2025 | 1:36 PM 1 minute to read MBTA Transit Police have arrested and charged a Cambridge man they branded a “deviant” after he allegedly masturbated on a Red Line train outside Harvard Square.
Robert McCarty, 49, pleaded not guilty Tuesday to one count of open and gross lewdness — a felony punishable by up to three years in prison, or two years in jail.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Dec. 31, 2025)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Restaurants Stay up to date on the best new restaurants, recent openings, and the biggest dining updates across Greater Boston's food scene.
Gato Exotico, which serves tacos and other Mexican dishes and cocktails, is the latest restaurant now open in Greater Boston.

Matt Tetrault, General Manager, Gato Exotico It’s a good time to be a Greater Boston diner, with exciting and diverse restaurant openings occurring all over the metro area as we look forward to a new year in 2026.
